text: Gjermund Eggen (5 June 1941 – 6 May 2019) was a Norwegian cross-country skier. He won three gold medals at the 1966 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships. He was awarded the Holmenkollen medal in 1968. He competed at the 1968 Winter Olympics in the 30 km event, but finished only 34th. Eggen was born in Engerdal, Norway. Eggen died in Elverum, Norway on 6 May 2019 at age 77. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * – click Holmenkollmedaljen for downloadable pdf file * – click Vinnere for downloadable pdf file Category:1941 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Norwegian skiers Category:Olympians for Norway
title: Gjermund Eggen
